availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George J. Ralston (Green County Shoe & Bootmaker AND private in the 21st Kentucky Infantry)

body.p: Kentucky shoe & boot maker and soldier. Lived in Green County in 1860. Married to Hamutal Quisenberry Ralston. Father of Mary F. Ralston, George E. Ralston, Alice J. Ralston, John S. Ralston, and William J. Ralston. Served as a private in the 21st Kentucky Infantry from December 1861 to October 1862.

bibl.p: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 94-95; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District No. 2, p. 70.
